conclusion: Each coloured bar acts as an inclined ramp.
Liquid leaving A, B or C first encounters the bar directly beneath it, travels along that bar, drops off its lower end, then continues down, possibly hitting other bars.
By tracing these successive contacts, one can see which of the bottom 'house-shaped' slots the stream finally reaches.
Stream from A ultimately falls into container D.
Stream from B ultimately falls into container G.
Stream from C ultimately falls into container F.
